trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, open the project that you modified when you completed the tutorial Get started with data.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, open the project that you modified when you completed the tutorial Get started with data.

trans-unit.source: Press the F5 key to run the app, then type text in Insert a TodoItem and click Save.
trans-unit.target: Press the F5 key to run the app, then type text in Insert a TodoItem and click Save.

trans-unit.source: Repeat the previous step at least three times, so that you have more than three items stored in the TodoItem table.
trans-unit.target: Repeat the previous step at least three times, so that you have more than three items stored in the TodoItem table.

trans-unit.source: In the default.js file, replace the RefreshTodoItems method with the following code:
trans-unit.target: In the default.js file, replace the RefreshTodoItems method with the following code:

trans-unit.source: This query, when executed during data binding, returns the top three items that are not marked as completed.
trans-unit.target: This query, when executed during data binding, returns the top three items that are not marked as completed.

trans-unit.source: Press the F5 key to run the app.
trans-unit.target: Press the F5 key to run the app.

trans-unit.source: Notice that only the first three results from the TodoItem table are displayed.
trans-unit.target: Notice that only the first three results from the TodoItem table are displayed.

trans-unit.source: (Optional) View the URI of the request sent to the mobile service by using message inspection software, such as browser developer tools or [Fiddler].
trans-unit.target: (Optional) View the URI of the request sent to the mobile service by using message inspection software, such as browser developer tools or [Fiddler].

trans-unit.source: Notice that the take(3) method was translated into the query option $top=3 in the query URI.
trans-unit.target: Notice that the take(3) method was translated into the query option $top=3 in the query URI.

trans-unit.source: Update the RefreshTodoItems method once more with the following code:
trans-unit.target: Update the RefreshTodoItems method once more with the following code:

trans-unit.source: This query skips the first three results and returns the next three after that.
trans-unit.target: This query skips the first three results and returns the next three after that.

trans-unit.source: This is effectively the second "page" of data, where the page size is three items.
trans-unit.target: This is effectively the second "page" of data, where the page size is three items.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial uses a simplified scenario by passing hard-coded paging values to the Take and Skip methods.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial uses a simplified scenario by passing hard-coded paging values to the Take and Skip methods.

trans-unit.source: In a real-world app, you can use queries similar to the above with a pager control or comparable UI to let users navigate to previous and next pages.
trans-unit.target: In a real-world app, you can use queries similar to the above with a pager control or comparable UI to let users navigate to previous and next pages.

trans-unit.source: You can also call the includeTotalCount method to get the total count of items available on the server, along with the paged data.
trans-unit.target: You can also call the includeTotalCount method to get the total count of items available on the server, along with the paged data.

trans-unit.source: (Optional) Again view the URI of the request sent to the mobile service.
trans-unit.target: (Optional) Again view the URI of the request sent to the mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Notice that the skip(3) method was translated into the query option $skip=3 in the query URI.
trans-unit.target: Notice that the skip(3) method was translated into the query option $skip=3 in the query URI.
